purpleculture_pinyin:
mí
full; to fill; completely; more
полный; заполнять; полностью; более
rtega_mnemonic:
彌彌RS
弥弥		to fill, to complete, more
  • somebody wields the bow 弓 and shoots animals to fill your 爾/尔 stomach
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 弥)
Pictophonetic: 爾 indicates the sound; 弓 (bow) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
彌補 [ mí bǔ ]: to complement; to make up for a deficiency
彌漫 [ mí màn ]: to pervade; to fill the air; diffuse; everywhere present; about to inundate (water); permeated by (smoke); filled with (dust); to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
彌留 [ mí liú ]: seriously ill and about to die
彌合 [ mí hé ]: to cause a wound to close up and heal
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 弓 [ gōng ] bow; curved, arched
    • 爾 [ ěr ] you; that, those; final particle
heisig_chinese_memo: At the carnival you fill the big bucket of water and let people use your bow to hit the target and make people drop into the water.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Don't try to shoot an arrow with your bow when you have the hiccups.  You might make a mistake and fill yourself with the arrow instead of the target.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from the " bow " to the sound of " Er " (or from the sound of " 𣍓 "). Xiao Zhuan makes "㣆" from the sound of " bow " and " xi ". Han Yin and Mawangdui silk script, Peking University Han bamboo slips follow "壐". " Xi " and "壐" are different bodies, both from the sound of " Er ". " Mi ", " 𢑃 " and "㣆" are heterogeneous relationships.

"Shuowen" is based on the original meaning of relaxing the bowstring. "Shuowen": "㣆, relax the bow. From the bow, the sound of the seal." This usage is not seen in ancient books and unearthed materials.

The inscription " Mi " means full, such as [Su Ming] pian: "Yu [bow 𣍓] (米) is afraid of (ji)." "Mi Xin" means "full heart". There are also examples of expressing fullness and pervasiveness in handed down ancient books, such as "Zhou Li. Chunguan. "Best wish": "The state-owned great cause, natural disasters, worship the shrine, pray to the temple." Zheng Xuan's note: "Mi, still everywhere." "Han Shu. "Li Guangsu Jian Chuan": "Fortunately, I have received great grace, and I have given my name to be a king, and I have tens of thousands of people.

" Mi " in the golden inscription also means long-term, such as the uncle □ Sun and father Gui: "Eternal order (fate) Milu (jue) to be born, ten thousand years without strength (Jiang)." In ancient books, for example, "Shang Shu. "Gu Ming": "Illness is getting worse, but it is still there." Kong Yingdashu: "Said that the disease is very difficult, and the disease has stayed in me for a long time." "Warring States. "Yan Ce III": "The Taifu's plan will last for a long time, and my heart will be lost. I'm afraid I can't take it for a while."

" Mi " also means far. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "Twenty-Three Years of Aigong": "Prepare a nephew with fat." Du pre-annotated: "Mi, far away. Kang Zifu's uncle, so called Mi Nephew." "Selected Works. Zhang Pingzi's "Xijing Fu": "The Tang Dynasty was opened before the middle of the Tang Dynasty, and it is full of hope." It also means wide and big. Such as "Han Shu. "The Legend of Yang Xiong": "The sky is beautiful and beautiful, and the ground is universal and deep." Ancient Yan Shi's note: "Mi, Guang Ye."

" Mi " means end and extreme. "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Mi, finally." Such as "Poetry. Daya. "Volume A": "Qi's disciple, a gentleman, is worthy of your miracle." Zheng Xuanjian: "Mi, finally." "Hou Han Shu. Biography of Wenyuan: "Climb Yaotai to look back, and to relieve worries in the future."

" Mi " means stitching and remedy. "Guang Ya. Interpretation II: "Mi, Sewing." Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Second Year of Zhaogong": "Dare to worship the sons of the seas and seas, and the widows are hopeful." Du pre-annotated: "Mis the seas, but still makes up." "Han Shu. "The Biography of Yuan Shao Liu Biao": "Mo Fu Fang is a foreigner who has not had time to train, add meaning to it, and Ji Ke will sew it."

" Mi " can be used as an adverb to express the degree of deepening. Such as "The Analects. "Zihan": "Look up to make the height, drill to make the firm." Xing Bingshu: "Mi, benefit." "Beijing University Hanjian. Lao Tzu. Chapter Ten": "It is far away, but its wisdom (knowledge) is less." The handed down Wang Biben "Laozi. Chapter 47" is written as "It goes farther, but knows less."

" Mi " is the same as " Mi ", meaning elimination. Such as "Zhou Li. Chunguan. "Xiao Zhu": "The soldiers of the disaster, far away disease." "Han. "Wang Mang Chuan 1": "Bai Zhu, therefore, fixed the mausoleum and Hou Chun Yu Chang, and committed rape with chaos." Yan Shi Gu's note: "Mi Reading means Mi. Mi, Stop Ye."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from the " bow ", " Seoul " sound (or from " 𣍓 " sound). Xiao Zhuan makes "㣆" from the sound of " bow " and " xi ". "Shuowen" is based on the original meaning of relaxing the bowstring.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「弓」，「爾」聲（或從「𣍓」聲）。小篆作「㣆」，從「弓」，「璽」聲。漢印和馬王堆帛書、北大漢簡從「壐」。「璽」和「壐」是異體，皆從「爾」聲。「彌」、「𢑃」和「㣆」為異體關係。

　　《說文》以為本義是放鬆弓弦。《說文》：「㣆，弛弓也。从弓，璽聲。」傳世古書和出土材料未見此用法。

　　金文「彌」表示滿，如[素命]鎛：「余[弓𣍓]（彌）心畏誋（忌）。」「彌心」即「滿心」。傳世古書也有表示滿、遍的例子，如《周禮．春官．大祝》：「國有大故、天災，彌祀社稷，禱祠。」鄭玄注：「彌，猶徧也。」《漢書．李廣蘇建傳》：「幸蒙大恩，賜號稱王，擁眾數萬，馬畜彌山，富貴如此。」

　　金文「彌」又表示長久，如叔□孫父簋：「永令（命）彌氒（厥）生，萬年無彊（疆）。」古書中的用例如《尚書．顧命》：「病日臻，既彌留。」孔穎達疏：「言病困已甚，病既久留於我身。」《戰國策．燕策三》：「太傅之計，曠日彌久，心惛然，恐不能須臾。」

　　「彌」還表示遠。如《左傳．哀公二十三年》：「以肥之得備彌甥也。」杜預注：「彌，遠也。康子父之舅氏，故稱彌甥。」《文選．張平子〈西京賦〉》：「前開唐中，彌望廣潒。」又表示廣、大。如《漢書．揚雄傳下》：「天麗且彌，地普而深。」顏師古注：「彌，廣也。」

　　「彌」表示終、極。《爾雅．釋言》：「彌，終也。」如《詩．大雅．卷阿》：「豈弟君子，俾爾彌爾性。」鄭玄箋：「彌，終也。」《後漢書．文苑列傳》：「登瑤臺以回望兮，冀彌日而消憂。」

　　「彌」表示縫合、補救。《廣雅．釋詁二》：「彌，縫也。」如《左傳．昭公二年傳》：「敢拜子之彌縫敝邑，寡君有望矣。」杜預注：「彌縫，猶補合也。」《後漢書．袁紹劉表列傳》：「莫府方詰外姦，未及整訓，加意含覆，冀可彌縫。」

　　「彌」可作副詞，表示程度加深。如《論語．子罕》：「仰之彌高，鑽之彌堅。」邢昺疏：「彌，益也。」《北大漢簡．老子．第十章》：「其出𢑃遠，其智（知）𢑃少。」傳世王弼本《老子．第四十七章》作「其出彌遠，其知彌少」。

　　「彌」同「弭」，表示消除。如《周禮．春官．小祝》：「彌災兵，遠辠疾。」《漢書．王莽傳上》：「白誅故定陵侯淳于長，以彌亂發姦。」顏師古注：「彌讀曰弭。弭，止也。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「弓」，「爾」聲（或從「𣍓」聲）。小篆作「㣆」，從「弓」，「璽」聲。《說文》以為本義是放鬆弓弦。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
彌 (Simplified: 弥)
Pinyin: mí
English Definition: full; to fill; completely; more
Total strokes: 17; Radical: 弓
Pictophonetic: 爾 indicates the sound; 弓 (bow) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 弓 [ gōng ] bow; curved, arched
    • 爾 [ ěr ] you; that, those; final particle
Example Words:
彌補 [ mí bǔ ]: to complement; to make up for a deficiency
彌漫 [ mí màn ]: to pervade; to fill the air; diffuse; everywhere present; about to inundate (water); permeated by (smoke); filled with (dust); to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
彌留 [ mí liú ]: seriously ill and about to die
彌合 [ mí hé ]: to cause a wound to close up and heal
More: 彌* | *彌 | *彌*

彌彌RS
弥弥 		to fill, to complete, more
  • somebody wields the bow 弓 and shoots animals to fill your 爾/尔 stomach
(Simplified: 弥)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 爾 indicates the sound; 弓 (bow) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 弓 [ gōng ] bow; curved, arched
    • 爾 [ ěr ] you; that, those; final particle
①滿，遍：彌滿。彌月(ａ．整一個月；b．嬰兒滿月)。彌望(滿眼)。彌天(滿天，形容極大的)。
②補，合：彌補。彌縫。彌封。
③更加：彌堅。欲蓋彌彰。
④水滿的樣子：瀰漫。
⑤久，遠：彌留(病久留不去，後稱病重將死)。彌亙(連綿不斷)。
⑥姓氏。
彌補 [ mí bǔ ]: to complement; to make up for a deficiency
彌漫 [ mí màn ]: to pervade; to fill the air; diffuse; everywhere present; about to inundate (water); permeated by (smoke); filled with (dust); to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
彌留 [ mí liú ]: seriously ill and about to die
彌合 [ mí hé ]: to cause a wound to close up and heal
(Simplified: 弥)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 爾 indicates the sound; 弓 (bow) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 6
Chinese: At the carnival you fill the big bucket of water and let people use your bow to hit the target and make people drop into the water.
Meaning: fill
Hanzi: 弥
Story: Don't try to shoot an arrow with your bow when you have the hiccups. You might make a mistake and fill yourself with the arrow instead of the target.
Kind: traditional

彌字的基本解释

彌
mí

彌
mǐ
均见“弥”。

彌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mí］
［《廣韻》武移切，平支，明。］
“弥1”的繁体字。亦作“镾1”。
(1)遍；满。
(2)广。
(3)终极。
(4)久远；久经。
(5)弥封；弥补。
(6)益；更加。
(7)姓。春秋卫有弥子瑕。参阅《通志·氏族三》。
[②]［mǐ］
［《集韻》毋婢切，上紙，明。］
“弥2”的繁体字。亦作“镾2”。
(1)通“弭”。止息。
(2)通“弭”。末端。参见“彌2龍”。
(3)通“靡”。奢侈。参见“彌2侈”。

彌字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【弓字部】　彌； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页361第11
〔古文〕?【廣韻】武移切【集韻】【韻會】民?切，?音迷。【說文】弛弓也。　又【玉篇】徧也。【周禮·春官·大祝】彌祀社稷禱。【註】彌猶徧也。　又【類篇】終也。【詩·大雅】誕彌厥月。【傳】彌，終也。　又【廣韻】益也。【論語】仰之彌高，鑽之彌堅。　又【廣韻】長也，久也。　又遠也。【左傳·哀二十三年】以肥之得備彌甥也。【註】彌遠也。　又祲也。【周禮·春官·?祲】掌十煇之法，七曰彌。【註】彌者，白虹彌天也。　又彌縫，補闕也。【易·繫辭】彌綸天地之道。【疏】彌，謂彌逢補合。【左傳·僖二十六年】彌縫其闕。　又彌彌，猶稍稍也。【前漢·韋賢傳】彌彌其失。　又彌龍，車飾。【史記·禮書】彌龍所以養威也。【註】索隱曰：謂金飾衡軛爲龍。　又扞彌，國名。【前漢·西域傳】扞彌國，今名寧彌。　又姓。【廣韻】三輔決錄有新豐彌升。又羌複姓，後秦將軍彌姐婆觸。　又【類篇】綿批切，音迷。嫛彌，嬰兒也。【禮·雜記】中路嬰兒失其母焉。【註】嬰，猶嫛彌也。　又【韻會】母婢切，彌上聲。【類篇】

["Guangyun" Wu Yiqie, flat branch, Ming. ]
"Mi 1" in traditional characters. Also known as "Non 1".
(1) times; full.
(2) Wide.
(3) Ultimate.
(4) A long time; a long time.
(5) Sealing; making up.
(6) Benefit; more.

[②]［mǐ］
["Ji Yun" is not cut by maidservants, put on paper, Ming. ]
"Mi 2" in traditional characters. Also known as "镾2".
(1) Through "Mi". cease.
(2) Through "Mi". End. See "Mi 2 Dragon".
(3) Through "extravagant". luxury. See "Mi 2 Luxury".
